Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 16, mean = 35, sd = 6.06 Sample 2: n = 11, mean = 29, sd = 3.96. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 28.31. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T distribution with 27 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 25 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 16 and 11 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 15 and 10 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 27 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 25 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 16 and 11 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 15 and 10 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
